ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.5_0: 26. The training rule on robes for a group
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.2_0: At that time the nun Thullanandā said to her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.3_0: “Venerable, we’re going to give a robe to the Sangha of nuns.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.5_0: “You’re very busy,” and she created an obstacle for them.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.6_0: Soon afterwards the house of that family burned down.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.8_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for our gift?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.9_0: Now we have neither possessions nor merit.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.10_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.11_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.12_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for a group to obtain a robe?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.13_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.16_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.18_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.19.1_0: ‘If a nun creates an obstacle for a group to obtain a robe, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.6_0: what is meant is the Sangha of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8_0: one of the six kinds of robes that is transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.10_0: if she creates an obstacle with the thought, “What can be done so that these people don’t give robe-cloth?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.11_0: If she creates an obstacle for another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.12_0: If she creates an obstacle for a number of nuns or for a single nun or for someone who is not fully ordained to obtain robe-cloth or another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.2_0: if she hinders it after demonstrating a benefit;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.4_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.5_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
